RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 10500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: Yoder Susan and Rivera Alan Yahir

RACE.FOOTNOTES: IMA SURE BET unhurried early to trail on the backside, split rivals while steadily advancing into the far turn, angled three wide at the head of the lane and closed well to be going away at the wire. TRAMA QUEEN stalked the pacesetter to the far turn, rallied to assume command at the head of the lane, opened a clear advantage but could not hold off the closing winner while clearly second best. RUNNETH OVER reserved off the leaders down the backside, commenced a long rally in the final bend and kept grinding through the lane to take the show. LADY CAIRO sped to the lead in the first turn, opened a wide advantage to the three-eighths pole and weakened coming home. HEART OF THE BEAST broke a step slow to be at the rear of the field early, rallied down the backside and flattened out in the far turn. BAD AND BEAUTIFUL was never a factor. CRYSTAL M showed brief speed to contend for a half mile and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Crystal M
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed, through early,

ENTRY.NAME: Bad and Beautiful
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Ima Sure Bet
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, steady advance, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Trama Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, assumed command, cleared, outfinished, 2d best

ENTRY.NAME: Heart of the Beast
ENTRY.OWNER: The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, raced wide, bid turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Runneth Over
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, long rally, grinding

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Cairo
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, clear lead, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Special Weight Purse 24300. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: M EIGHTY prompted the pace through the turn, engaged the leader in upper stretch and out-finished that one in a determined drive from two wide down the lane. SIR MASON took the lead shortly from the gate, opened a clear lead into the turn, responded well when challenged in upper stretch and finished willingly while out-kicked in deep stretch. XERXES was squeezed between rivals leaving the gate to be at the rear, settled into stride down the backside and mounted a late bid in the stretch. MR. BLUTARSKY tracked the pace from three wide and lacked a response when called upon. THIRTYEIGHT WISHES bumped rival at the start when breaking outward, raced up to stalk the pace for a half mile and weakened in the lane. STILL WICKED bumped at the start when breaking inward, quickly angled out early, dropped to the back of the field and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Mason
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, responded, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: M Eighty
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, rally 2w, determined drive

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Blutarsky
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Thirtyeight Wishes
ENTRY.OWNER: Tooley Jennifer and Dolce Vita Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outward, bumped rival, stalked pace, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Xerxes
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start, settled, late bid

ENTRY.NAME: Still Wicked
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, trailed, outrun

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 10900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 29. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KAY BEE GEE reserved off the early pace, swept up three wide to take command midway on the bend, opened a clear advantage and held sway. LUCKY ROAD prompted the early pacesetter, was overtaken by the winner in the turn and kept on gamely down the lane to surge up late and just miss. HIGH CUPPER unhurried in the early going to trail, saved ground cutting the corner coming home and was gaining late. ROSY APPLE raced along the rail in striking distance in to the turn, steadied on the bend when the pacesetter angled in, lost all momentum, was taken around stopping rival and never regained closing response and lost crop inside the final sixteenth. ISLAND WINTER broke flat-footed to be at the rear of the field early, raced wide down the backstretch and was never a threat. DE PURA SANGRE showed speed to take the early lead while racing in the three path, angled in on the turn causing rival to steady along the fence and weakened nearing the quarter pole to drop from contention.

ENTRY.NAME: De Pura Sangre
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed, raced wide, angled in, through after half

ENTRY.NAME: Rosy Apple
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied turn, lost momentum, chased, lost crop late stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: High Cupper
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, cut corner, late gain

ENTRY.NAME: Kay Bee Gee
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, bid 3 wide turn, swept clear, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Island Winter
ENTRY.COMMENT: flattfooted break, raced wide, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, kept on, gamely, late surge

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 29. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHLOES ANGEL tracked the leaders to the turn, circled four wide to engage the leaders midway on the bend, took the lead turning for home, dueled with the runner-up the length of the stretch and prevailed at the line. SHEZA POP STAR stalked the pace into the turn, rallied splitting horse on the turn to challenge for the lead at the head of the stretch, battled with the winner down the lane and was denied at the wire. COWCHI prominently placed early on, settled back off the pace in the bend, cut the corner to loom in upper stretch and kept on willingly through the lane. CHECK OUT LINE reserved off the pace to the quarter pole and rallied willingly through the stretch. SHEZA FINE JUSTICE was never a threat. KISSTHECROSS showed speed to set the pace and was through after a half. PSYCHOANALYST broke awkwardly to be at the back of the field, raced five wide down the backside and never was a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Kissthecross
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Cowchi
ENTRY.COMMENT: prominent early, settled, cut corner, loomed, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Sheza Fine Justice
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Sheza Pop Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid between, battled, denied

ENTRY.NAME: Check Out Line
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, finished willingly, gaining late

ENTRY.NAME: Psychoanalyst
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke awkwardly, trailed 5w, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Chloes Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, circled 4 wide, duel stretch, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 29. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCARLETT'S AWISH set the pace from the fence while pressed on the lead, dueled through the lane, shook clear of pressers in deep stretch and just held the closer safe at the wire in a game effort. BAREFOOT BEACH reserved off the pace into the turn, gained ground while saving ground along the rail in the bend, angled five wide in upper stretch and closed well late to just miss. SUSHI Q pressed the pace from three wide through the turn, briefly took the lead in the lane, lugged-in through the lane causing rival to steady in mid-stretch and finished evenly late. NORTHERN JOURNEY slow early to trail the field, commenced a steady advance in the turn and finished willingly. THE LAST APPLE well placed while tracking the leaders through the turn and lacked a closing response when called upon. BEEBLEGEE failed to menace. SWEET EMPIRE dueled from between rivals to the top of the stretch, weakened in the drive and was taken up late in the stretch when impeded. CONGRATS JENSEN contended early on and faded in the turn. THE STEWARDS POSTED AN INQUIRY INTO THE STRETCH RUN AND UPON REVIEW DISQUALIFIED SUSHI Q AND PLACED HER SEVENTH FOR INTERFERENCE IN THE STRETCH RUN.

ENTRY.NAME: Congrats Jensen
ENTRY.COMMENT: contended early, faded, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Barefoot Beach
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, saved ground, angled 5 wide, closed well, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Northern Journey
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, steady advance, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: The Last Apple
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, long drive, no late response

ENTRY.NAME: Scarlett's Awish
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, inside, gamely, just held

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Empire
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled between, weakened stretch, steadied late

ENTRY.NAME: Beeblegee
ENTRY.COMMENT: never menaced, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Sushi Q
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, brief lead, lugged in stretch, even late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 11100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 29. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Winners Since November 29, 2022 Preferred)(Ohio Registe red Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEACH FRONT stalked the pace down the backstretch, rallied three wide to engage the pacesetter in upper stretch, dueled in the lane, took command in deep stretch while drifting in late to prevail. EXPLOSIVE HUMOUR set the pace to upper stretch, responded when challenged down the lane and was outkicked late in the drive. LUCKY JUNIOR reserved off the leaders for a half mile, angled six wide turning for home and finished with good late energy. LOCK ON unhurried in the early going, rallied with an early bid to threaten in upper stretch and finished evenly. BOSS BEAR chased the pacesetters from three wide through the turn and made a mild rally in spite of rider losing his crop in upper stretch. CALL WEST trailed to the quarter pole and passed weakening rivals in the lane. TUFF ATTACK prompted the pace for a half mile and faded. GAMBLER was never a threat. BLUE SKY'S ABOVE tracked the leaders from a striking position through the turn and flattened out in the stretch. THE RIDER OF EXPLOSIVE HUMOR CLAIMED FOUL FOR INTERFERENCE BY THE WINNER IN THE STRETCH, UPON REVIEW THE STEWARDS MADE NO CHANGE.

ENTRY.NAME: Tuff Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, contended, fade

ENTRY.NAME: Lock On
ENTRY.OWNER: Haehn T R and Molumby John
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, early bid, even late

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Sky's Above
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, bid flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Junior
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, angled 6 wide, good late energy

ENTRY.NAME: Explosive Humour
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, responded, outfinished,

ENTRY.NAME: Beach Front
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid 3 wide, duel stretch, drift in, clear late

ENTRY.NAME: Call West
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Gambler
ENTRY.COMMENT: never menaced, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Boss Bear
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3w, mild bid, lost crop

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OFFICIALLY YOURS set the pace from two wide into the turn under pressure, lost the lead briefly from an inside challenge nearing the quarter pole, re-rallied turning for home and drew off in the lane clearly the best. MISS SPRINGSTEEN bumped at the start, tracked the leaders from three wide in the turn and rallied down the lane to gain the place. COMPUTE THIS stalked the pace to the turn, rallied up the fence to take the lead at the quarter pole and weakened through the stretch. CURLIN PEARLS raced wide down the backstretch, angled in to the rail on the turn, rallied mildly up the fence to upper stretch and finished evenly. PARLAY CHARLIE was never a threat. SPOOKY LITTLE GIRL bumped rival leaving the gate, raced prominently to press the early pace and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Compute This
ENTRY.OWNER: Sheppell Peter J and Royer Family Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid inside, brief lead, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Officially Yours
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, lost lead, rallied, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Spooky Little Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, prominent, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Springsteen
ENTRY.OWNER: Blazing Meadows Farm LLC and S G M Thoroughbred Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, tracked leaders, late gain for place

ENTRY.NAME: Parlay Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin Pearls
ENTRY.COMMENT: raced wide, angled in, even late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 92. Starter Allowance Purse 19800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $7,500 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CUGINE tracked the leaders from the rail down the backside, rallied angling out four wide at the head of the lane and closed well with a late surge to be up in time. COME SEE ABOUT IT prompted the pace to the far turn, took command from two wide on the bend, held the lead through the stretch until the final strides and was caught in the shadow of the wire. THRU THE VINE set a pressured pace to the quarter pole, responded to the challenge but could not keep pace late in the lane. I'LL FIGURE IT OUT reserved off the pace to the far turn and was set down to a long drive and gained ground in grinding fashion. FRANCO trailed for the first half, mounted a rail rally through the final bend and flattened out coming home. GLOBAL EMPIRE contended early to be with the pacesetters for a half mile and faded. MY BROTHER CAM was caught six wide in the first turn, dropped to the rear of the field down the backside and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Franco
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, rally turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Cugine
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, angled 4w, closed well, late surge, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Come See About It
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, took command, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Thru the Vine
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, responded, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Global Empire
ENTRY.COMMENT: contended, fade

ENTRY.NAME: I'll Figure It Out
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, long drive, grinding

ENTRY.NAME: My Brother Cam
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6 wide 1st turn, dropped back, no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 9 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowa nces).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIER ONE broke wide leaving the gate, was taken in hand to be rated off the pace down the backside, rallied into the final bend splitting rivals while gaining on the leaders, tipped three wide to the clear in upper stretch and wore the leader down late in a determined drive. LEROYISALAGNIAPPE pressed the pace for the first three-eighths, took the lead from two wide while under constant pressure, repelled the pressers in upper stretch, responded to the late closer in deep stretch but could not hold on. JEBIP tracked the leaders down the backside, made an early three wide bid on the turn to challenge for the lead at the quarter pole and flattened out down the lane. ANIMO ROBERTO slow early to trail to the far turn, rallied through the bend and finished evenly. RED COMET pressed the pace to the far turn and weakened. WATCHOUTFORWEAVER went evenly failing to menace. SMOOCHER was never a threat. LITTLE TOY GUNS stalked the pace and tired. DANES HEART dueled on the lead from the fence through the final bend and gave way in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Smoocher
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Danes Heart
ENTRY.OWNER: McFadden Jr Joseph A and Fewster Melody K
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Red Comet
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Leroyisalagniappe
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled on lead, shook free, gamely, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Animo Roberto
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, rally turn, even late

ENTRY.NAME: Little Toy Guns
ENTRY.OWNER: Tooley Jennifer and Beckett Racing Team LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Jebip
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, early bid 3w, loomed, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Watchoutforweaver
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Ultra Championship Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: went evenly, failed to menace

ENTRY.NAME: Tier One
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke wide, settled in hand, split rivals, determined
